verses.roman:
khaṁ vyabhram uditādityaṁ
vāta-varṣaṁ ca dāruṇam
niśamyoparataṁ gopān
govardhana-dharo 'bravīt

synonyms: kham—the sky; vi-abhram—empty of clouds; udita—arisen; ādityam—with the sun; vāta-varṣam—the wind and rain; ca—and; dāruṇam—fierce; niśamya—seeing; uparatam—ceased; gopān—to the cowherds; govardhana-dharaḥ—the lifter of Govardhana Hill; abravīt—spoke.
translation: Seeing that the fierce wind and rain had now ceased, the sky had become clear of rainclouds, and the sun had risen, Lord Kṛṣṇa, the lifter of Govardhana Hill, spoke to the cowherd community as follows.
